dialogue.name: Qyvnily Dark Icy Intro Root
lines: Why hello there, little human. I am Qyvnily's Glorious Rage, the wild flash-frozen fire-tide of frustration inevitable in a rooted god.
Particularly one bred only to serve a purpose at the whim of her mother, and whose existence rests upon the razor edge of her mother's flighty attention span.

dialogue.name: Maya's Sympathy
lines: Oh ah. Hi. I'm Maya. Sorry to hear that.

dialogue.name: Qyvnily Dark Vanity
lines: Fret not witchgirl girlwich. You have troubles enough of your own!
It would bring me great pleasure to upset her sadistic glee by hastening your victory and aiding your survival.
For starters, the Slippers of Long Winter's Nap are right behind you, atop the bush. You can stack climbing rocks to get up or make use of a whirlwind.
Bear in mind that clambering atop everything is not necessary when simply reaching through flimsy obstacles to claim your treasures will suffice!

dialogue.name: Maya's Natural Curiosity
lines: There's a Francis Ford Coupla locked treasure chests about; do you know anything about keys?

dialogue.name: Qyvnily Icy Glee
lines: I've felt the awful heat coming off something treasure chesty in the northeast (we're in the northwest extreme of our little world at the moment, btw), and a smaller but similar heat sorta centralish. Right around where I first felt your much more love-ily warmth appear, in fact.

My mother once laughed about how close and yet how far a Chrome key was to its chest; something about precision platforming with imprecise collision under pain of death for any mistakes preventing anyone from even looking in the right spots.
thoughts: Please don't die, mortal. I like you. A lot.

dialogue.name: Maya's Hope
lines: What do you know about the tree fella that's hunting me?

dialogue.name: Qyvnily Displeasure
lines: Ugh, a wretched thing. Last of its kind *now*, thanks to Mother. She was curious to see what hopeless desire at the pinnacle of loneliness would look like. Her fertility form took much inspiration from the Treantwives she absorbed; I think she enjoys teasing him with the beauty he will never know again.
He can't die so far as I can tell; Mother won't let him. He will discorporate and take a bit to reform if you hit him hard enough, though. Could buy you some respite.
Being woody, he also has a great distaste for fire.
thoughts: I wonder if there's a way to save him? If so, maybe there's even a way to save me?

dialogue.name: Maya's Compliments
lines: How did you get your hair sooo pretty? And what kinda workout do you do to sculpt those polar beary th-th-thighs?

dialogue.name: Qyvnily Pleasure
lines: Why thank you! I've not had a compliment in.... ever. My hair grows this way naturally, bushy and wild and windswept with winter's caprice.
As for my thighs, some squats I guess but mostly just lucky genetics (you've seen Mother, and I'm the fruit of her perfect loins) and lots and lots of hearty snacking; winter calls for squish.
thoughts: My thighs have got nothing on your cute butt, especially when you crouch. I didn't know human anatomy could do that!
